summary:
The Security Council, recalling previous resolutions on Lebanon, particularly 425, 426, 1559, 1680, 1701, 1773, 1832, 1884, and 1937, and statements on the situation in Lebanon, 
decides to extend the mandate of UNIFIL for a new period of one year, until 31 August 2012, without amendment. 
The Council reiterates its support for Lebanon's territorial integrity, sovereignty, and political independence, and reaffirms its commitment to the full implementation of resolution 1701. 
It calls upon all parties to strengthen efforts to implement resolution 1701 without delay, and expresses concern at violations, particularly on 15 May and 1 August 2011. 
The Council commends the Lebanese Armed Forces and UNIFIL for preventing escalation during protests on 5 June 2011 and emphasizes the importance of compliance with the prohibition on arms sales and supply. 
It condemns terrorist attacks against UNIFIL peacekeepers on 27 May and 26 July, and welcomes Lebanon's commitment to bring perpetrators to justice. 
The Council commends UNIFIL's role and dedication, and requests the Secretary-General to conduct a strategic review of UNIFIL by the end of the year. 
It calls for further enhancement of cooperation between UNIFIL and the Lebanese Armed Forces, and for an acceleration of the strategic dialogue between them. 
The Council determines that the situation in Lebanon continues to constitute a threat to international peace and security.
Here is a concise summary of the Security Council document:

The Security Council:
- Calls on all parties to respect the cessation of hostilities and the Blue Line.
- Condemns terrorist attacks against UNIFIL and urges respect for its safety and freedom of movement.
- Urges cooperation towards a permanent ceasefire and long-term solution as envisioned in resolution 1701 (2006).
- Urges Israel to withdraw from northern Ghajar without delay.
- Reaffirms the establishment of an area free of armed personnel between the Blue Line and the Litani River.
- Welcomes efforts to implement zero-tolerance policy on sexual exploitation and abuse.
- Requests the Secretary-General to report on implementation of resolution 1701 (2006) every four months.
- Stresses the importance of a comprehensive, just and lasting peace in the Middle East.
- Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
